line.line: "Above all other admonition on
my part," he said, "cherish and follow
this one: Do not Despair. That is the
most dangerous gulph on which
you perpetually totter; but you
must reassure your steps, and take
hope to guide you. Hope, and your
wounds will be atready h already half
half healed: but if you obstinately despair,
there never more will be comfort for
you. Believe me, my dearest friend,
that there is a joy that the sun and
earth and all its beauties can bestow
that you will one day feel. The refreshing
bliss of Love will again visit your
heart, and undo the spell that binds you
to woe, untill you wonder how your
eyes could be closed in the long ni night
that burthens you. I dare not hope
that I have inspired you with sufficient
y interest that the thought of me, and
the affection that I shall ever bear
you, will soften your melancholy and
